The transmission of SARS-CoV-2 between bats and intermediate hosts might be attributed to the contamination of food environments by animal droppings, restricted air flow in the environment, or the aggregation behavior of animals.
14 Transmission between humans did not exclude the fecal-oral route, and the transmission intensity depended on the length of the incubation period and the importance of asymptomatic carriers with regard to disease transmission.
